title: Windows reboot is unreliable
body:
### Vagrant version
Vagrant 2.2.6

### Host operating system
Ubuntu 18.04 with the libvirt provider.

### Guest operating system
Windows 2019

### Vagrantfile
```ruby
config.vm.provision "shell", path: "ps.ps1", args: "provision.ps1", reboot: true
```

The full file is at https://github.com/rgl/visual-studio-community-vagrant/blob/master/Vagrantfile.

### Expected behavior
Reboot should work while ignoring transient errors (like `Errno::ECONNREFUSED`) until it can prove the reboot is done.

### Actual behavior
It crashed with the following stacktrace:

```
==> default: Waiting for machine to reboot...
==> default: Clearing any previously set forwarded ports...
==> default: Removing domain...
/opt/vagrant/embedded/gems/2.2.6/gems/httpclient-2.8.3/lib/httpclient/session.rb:623:in `rescue in create_socket': Connection refused - Connection refused - connect(2) for "192.168.121.195" port 5985 (192.168.121.195:5985) (Errno::ECONNREFUSED)
```

### Steps to reproduce

1. vagrant up
